definition: to get carried away/to forget oneself
to forget/to overlook/to neglect
(classical particle similar to 於|于[yu2]) in/at/from/because/than/(classical final particle similar to 嗎|吗[ma5], 吧[ba5], 呢[ne5], expressing question, doubt or astonishment)
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)

sentences.english: Don't be too happy to forget yourself.
They're starting to get a little carried away.
sentences.chinese: 她們開始有點忘乎所以了。

sentences.english: One mustn't be carried away by one's successes.
sentences.chinese: 在勝利面前不要忘乎所以。

sentences.english: donnot so glad that you forget who are you.
Her arguments became more desperate and more vehement.
sentences.chinese: 她的爭論更加忘乎所以，更加強烈。

sentences.english: If one day, I forget oneself, please send me to stay in, in this time.
sentences.chinese: 如果有一天，我忘乎所以，請把我留在，在這時光裏。

sentences.english: Don’t be so happy as to forget everything.
Those young teenagers are carrying machine guns, and they feel trigger-happy.
sentences.chinese: 那些年輕人拿着機關槍，忘乎所以。

definition: so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
elated/light and airy feeling (after a few drinks)/smug and conceited/complacent
immensely pleased with oneself (idiom)/proud/complacent
to think highly of oneself
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
immeasurably self-satisfied
fully content with one's achievements (idiom)/complacent
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
indulge in pleasure and forget home and duty (idiom)
immensely pleased with oneself (idiom)/proud/complacent
to not know the reason/to not know what to do
smiles of exultation/radiant with delight
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
lit. to be muddled in the brain (idiom); fig. excited and unable to act rationally/to go to one's head
self-satisfied/self-imbued/narcissistic
lit. spirit and soul upside down (idiom); infatuated and head over heels in love/fascinated/captivated
